Content:: The base of skull, also known as the cranial base or the cranial floor, is the most inferior area of the skull. It is composed of the endocranium and the lower parts of the calvaria. Structures found at the base of the skull are for example: There are five bones that make up the base of the skull: Base of the skull. Upper surface Base of skull Base of skull - crista galli, cribriform plate and foramen cecum Base of skull - sella turcica The anterior, middle and posterior cranial fossa in different colors
